intro: Hibbertia rupicola, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers with red markings. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Hibbertia rupicola is a perennial shrub that produces showy blooms from spring to early summer.
